sentence.text: Patients 9 had maxillar hypoplasia and micrognathia and prominent, dysplastic ears (Fig. 1f, g).
They had hypoplastic thumbs with thenar atrophy and no movement in the distal interphalangeal joints (Fig. 2oâ€“r).
The first toes were short and stiff, and between second and third toes there was a syndactyly (Fig. 3d, e). exhibited enamel hypoplasia of the teeth. had cryptorchidism and glandular epispadias.
